column5: Three of us went to St. Williams Sunday and each brought home 15 to 25. My biggest was 14" We fish past the huts and a little west, away from the crowd. Used a micro jig with a Perch eye and also used a Buckshot that caught some of the bigger ones. Ice was bare and made pulling the clam out a breeze.
Some well fed perch right there.
wow those are some nice looking perch! Good work!
Nice fish Dave...no machine?....thats a long haul but with cleats on it's much easier i guess....
Right on bye. Nice catch. Just need some chips and dressing to go with them.
Like someone else posted earlier - how long a walk would that be ?
Maybe next time I can catch something more like that on LPB!! They look delicious!!!
Rob, I would say about 1 KM and the ice was good for walking, cleats were a must. Good luck if you get out.
A great day out for you, Dave. Congrats and thanks for sharing.
